AssessmentBasis.description: Basis on which an EYA or WRA component has been assessed.
AssessmentBasis.title: AssessmentBasis

BasicStatisticType.description: Statistic type that can be specified by a single label.
BasicStatisticType.title: BasicStatisticType

Dataset.description: Collection of labelled data for one specific quantity. The data is labelled by specifying dimensions and including coordinates along the dimensions for each data value.

anyOf.description: Period of or in time that a dataset is applicable.
anyOf.title: Assessment Period

assessment_period.description: Optional period of or in time that has been assessed and for which the dataset is applicable. This field is to be included only when relevant.

comments.description: Optional comments on the dataset, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the dataset, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

items.description: Dimension along which dataset values are assigned.
items.title: Dataset Dimension

dimensions.description: Dimensions along which the dataset is binned. All statistics within the same dataset object must have the same dimensions. The dimensions must correspond to and be listed in the same order as the coordinates for the values of all statistics. A dataset without dimensions can only have a single value for each statistic.
dimensions.title: Dimensions

label.description: Optional label of the dataset, which should not be empty if the field is included.
label.title: Label

statistics.description: List of dataset statistic objects that each include data values for a specific statistic type. For example, there may be two statistics, one for mean values and one for standard deviation values.

items.description: Dataset values for one specific statistic type.

comments.description: Optional comments on the dataset statistic, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the dataset statistic, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

anyOf.description: Probability of exceedance level statistic type.

exceedance_level.description: The dimensionless probability of exceedance level (i.e. probability value between 0.0 and 1.0) of the statistic.
exceedance_level.title: Exceedance Level

anyOf.title: Exceedance Level Statistic Type

statistic_type.description: Type of statistic that the component of the dataset contains. All values must correspond to this statistic. It can be either the string identifier of a basic statistic type (e.g. 'mean') or a specification of a probability of exceedance level.
statistic_type.title: Statistic Type

values.description: Dataset value(s) as a single number or one or more values at coordinates. If more than one value is included the values must be represented together with coordinates. A single value can be included either with or without coordinates. The coordinates must correspond to and be listed the same order as the dimensions specified for the dataset.
values.title: Values

items.title: Dataset Statistic

statistics.title: Statistics

Dataset.title: Dataset

DerivedDatasetClassification.description: Classification of a derived operational dataset.

data_source_type.description: The data source type, which for derived data is 'secondary'.
data_source_type.title: Data Source Type

data_type.description: The type of operational data, categorised as 'derived' for all derived operational datasets (e.g. operational reports or databases with aggregate data). Details of the data type shall be included in the description of the operational dataset, including the type of derived dataset (e.g. an operational report), who produced it (e.g. the turbine OEM) and any relevant details known about how the data were processed.
data_type.title: Data Type

DerivedDatasetClassification.title: DerivedDatasetClassification

annual_energy_production.description: Annual energy production (AEP) estimates at the turbine location(s) in gigawatt hour (GW h). The dimension of the first standard result dataset should be 'wind_farm_id'. The dimension of the second standard result dataset should be 'turbine_id'. Further results with other dimensions may be included optionally.
annual_energy_production.title: Annual Energy Production

OperationalRestriction.description: Specifications of a restriction that limits power output. In the current draft of the schema, 'label', 'description' and 'comments' fields are available to describe the restriction with free text. This is intended to be expanded into a more comprehensive data model.

comments.description: Optional comments on the operational restriction, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Description of the operational restriction.
description.title: Description

end_datetime.description: Optional operational restriction end datetime in the ISO 8601 standard format with the 'T' required between the calendar date and time, i.e. YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss. In cases where the time is not relevant (i.e. only the date is relevant), hours, minutes and seconds shall all be set to zero. If using the time part, the timezone of the data must be consistent with the UTC offset specified for the EYA DEF document.
end_datetime.title: End Datetime

label.description: Short label to indicate the type of operational restriction.
label.title: Label

start_datetime.description: Optional operational restriction start datetime in the ISO 8601 standard format with the 'T' required between the calendar date and time, i.e. YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss. In cases where the time is not relevant (i.e. only the date is relevant), hours, minutes and seconds shall all be set to zero. If using the time part, the timezone of the data must be consistent with the UTC offset specified for the EYA DEF document.
start_datetime.title: Start Datetime

OperationalRestriction.title: OperationalRestriction

Organisation.description: Basic metadata to describe an organisation. This model is for example used for issuing and receiving organisations of an energy yield assessment.

examples: 5 Munro Road, Summit Centre, Sgurrsville, G12 0YE, UK
address.title: Address

contact_name.description: Name(s) of contact person(s) in the organisation.
contact_name.title: Contact Name

Organisation.title: Organisation

efficiency.description: Dimensionless plant performance efficiency (loss factor) results.
efficiency.title: Efficiency

SingleSourceDatasetClassification.description: Classification of an operational dataset from a single source.

data_source_type.description: The type of the operational data source. Primary data, such as primary SCADA data, comes directly from the source without any intermediary. Secondary data covers all other types of data sources, where the data does not come directly from the source, such as secondary SCADA data provided in harmonised form by a data management service provider.
data_source_type.title: Operational Data Source Type

data_type.description: The type of operational data, categorised as 'scada' for data from a Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system, 'metered' for data from a production meter and 'environmental_measurement' for data from an (on-site) environmental measurement station such as a meteorological mast or a remote sensing device (RSD).
data_type.title: Data Type

SingleSourceDatasetClassification.title: SingleSourceDatasetClassification

unit.description: The measurement unit of time in which the time resolution is specified.
unit.title: Time Measurement Unit

value.description: The value of the time resolution in the specified unit. For example, for 10-minute resolution, the value is '10.0' and the unit is 'minute'
value.title: Value

TimeVariabilityType.description: Type of time variability considered for an assessment element.
TimeVariabilityType.title: TimeVariabilityType

relative_energy_uncertainty.description: Uncertainty assessment results as dimensionless relative values expressed in terms of AEP (annual energy production) and calculated as the standard deviation of the energy uncertainty distribution divided by the net P50 (50% probability of exceedance level) AEP.
relative_energy_uncertainty.title: Relative Energy Uncertainty

relative_wind_speed_uncertainty.description: Uncertainty assessment results as dimensionless relative values expressed in terms of wind speed and calculated as the standard deviation of the wind speed uncertainty distribution divided by the mean wind speed.
relative_wind_speed_uncertainty.title: Relative Wind Speed Uncertainty

description: IEC 61400-15-2 EYA DEF top-level data model.

$id.description: Optional URI of the EYA DEF JSON document, which should have the field name '$id' in the JSON document.
$id.title: URI

$schema.description: URI of the EYA DEF JSON Schema, which should have the field name '$schema' in the JSON document. It is assumed to be the latest published version if not included.
$schema.title: EYA DEF JSON Schema URI

comments.description: Optional comments on the energy yield assessment (EYA) report, which should not be empty if the field is included.
examples: Report labelled as draft. To be finalised following review by all parties.
comments.title: Comments

confidentiality_classification.description: Optional confidentiality classification of the report document, if relevant. The field should not be empty if it is included.
confidentiality_classification.title: Confidentiality Classification

contract_reference.description: Optional reference to contract between the issuing and receiving organisations that governs the energy yield assessment (EYA) report document, if relevant. The field should not be empty if it is included.
contract_reference.title: Contract Reference

contributors.description: List of report contributors (e.g. author and verifier)

items.description: Contributor to an energy yield assessment.

contribution_comments.description: Optional comments to clarify contribution, which should not be empty if the field is included.
contribution_comments.title: Contribution Comments

email_address.description: Optional email address of the contributor, which should not be empty if the field is included.
email_address.title: Email Address

items.title: Report Contributor

contributors.title: Contributors

description.description: Optional description of the energy yield assessment (EYA) report, which should not be empty if the field is included.
examples: An updated document to incorporate the latest measurement data.
description.title: Description

document_id.description: Optional ID of the report document; not including the version when 'document_version' is used. This will typically follow the convention of the document management system of the issuing organisation(s). The field should not be empty if it is included.
document_id.title: Document ID

document_version.description: Optional version of the report document, also known as revision. As with the 'document_id', this will typically follow the document versioning convention of the document management system of the issuing organisation(s). The field should not be empty if it is included.
document_version.title: Document Version

epsg_srid.description: EPSG Spatial Reference System Identifier (SRID) for the Coordinate Reference System (CRS) used for all spatial data (e.g. turbine locations) in the EYA DEF document. All location coordinates must be reported in this one CRS, which must have an EPSG code. If different CRSs are used, the data must be converted to be consistent with the EPSG code specified here.
epsg_srid.title: Epsg Srid

issue_date.description: Report issue date in the ISO 8601 standard format for a calendar date, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.
issue_date.title: Issue Date

issuing_organisations.description: The organisation(s) issuing the report (e.g. consultant).
issuing_organisations.title: Issuing Organisations

items.description: A measurement metadata document according to the IEA Task 43 WRA Data Model JSON Schema.
items.title: Measurement Station Metadata

measurement_stations.description: Optional list of measurement station metadata documents according to the IEA Wind Task 43 WRA Data Model, including all measurement stations relevant to the EYA, if any. It is recommended that one metadata document be completed for each measurement station, although the WRA Data Model allows for grouping multiple measurement stations into a single document.
measurement_stations.title: Measurement Stations

project_country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 two-letter code of the country where the project under assessment is located.
project_country.title: Alpha2 Country Code

project_name.description: Name of the project under assessment.
project_name.title: Project Name

receiving_organisations.description: Optional specification of organisation(s) receiving the report (e.g. client), if relevant.
receiving_organisations.title: Receiving Organisations

anyOf.description: Metadata for a reference meteorological dataset.

comments.description: Optional comments on the meteorological dataset, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Description of the meteorological dataset.
examples: In-house WRF simulation seeded with MERRA2 reanalysis.
description.title: Description

end_date.description: End of the data period in the ISO 8601 standard format for a calendar date, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.
end_date.title: End Date

id.description: Unique ID for the reference meteorological dataset within the EYA DEF document.
id.title: Id

locations.description: The horizontal spatial location(s) of the meteorological data, with each location item including an ID for referencing in addition to the spatial coordinates. Where a large number of locations have been used (i.e. a large grid) and it is not relevant to include all, a subset can be included here and elaborated upon in the comments. All locations for which results are presented must be included.

items.description: Specification of a horizontal location in space with an ID.

id.description: Unique ID for the location within the EYA DEF document.
id.title: Id

items.title: Id Location

locations.title: Locations

start_date.description: Start of the data period in the ISO 8601 standard format for a calendar date, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.
start_date.title: Start Date

time_resolution.description: Time resolution of the reference meteorological data.

anyOf.title: Reference Meteorological Dataset Metadata

anyOf.description: A measurement metadata document according to the IEA Task 43 WRA Data Model JSON Schema.
anyOf.title: Measurement Station Metadata

reference_meteorological_datasets.description: Optional list of metadata documents that describe the reference meteorological datasets used in the long-term prediction process of the EYA and/or used as input wind resource data for calibration against reference operational data. Reference datasets may include ground-based meteorological (met) stations, reanalysis datasets and mesoscale model datasets. Either the EYA DEF schema for reference meteorological dataset metadata or the IEA Wind Task 43 WRA Data Model may be used. One metadata document shall be completed for each relevant reference meteorological dataset.
reference_meteorological_datasets.title: Reference Meteorological Datasets

comments.description: Optional comments on the reference wind farm, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the reference wind farm, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

id.description: Unique ID for the reference wind farm within the EYA DEF document.
id.title: Id

operational_datasets.description: List of metadata documents describing the operational datasets from the reference wind farm that were used.

items.description: Metadata for a reference wind farm operational dataset.

classification.description: Classification of the type of data and the type of data source. Separate schemas are available to classify unprocessed datasets from a single source, including classification of the data type and source, and datasets that have been derived (aggregated and/or processed, such as operational reports and national databases), including only a classification of the data type as 'derived'. For single source data types (e.g. SCADA) it is meaningful to distinguish between primary and secondary source types, whereas for a derived data type the source type is always secondary.
classification.title: Classification

comments.description: Optional comments on the dataset, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

data_variables.description: A list of the data variables included in the dataset and used in the assessment. For a large dataset (such as a full wind turbine SCADA dataset) this field should not include all the variables but only the ones that were used in the analysis.

items.description: Reference wind farm operational data variable.

comments.description: Optional comments on the data variable, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

data_level.description: Whether the operational data variable is provided for each individual wind turbine ('turbine_level'), is corresponding to or aggregated to the wind farm level ('wind_farm_level') or corresponds to a different ('other') level such as an environmental measurement station.
data_level.title: Operational Data Level

description.description: Optional description of the data variable, which should not be empty if the field is included. This may include clarification of the point of measurement, where relevant.
description.title: Description

label.description: Optional label of the data variable, which should not be empty if the field is included. This can be used to provide the label assigned to the variable in the dataset (e.g. field of column name), but does not need to.
label.title: Label

statistic_types.description: Optional list of the types of statistics included for the data variable.
statistic_types.title: Statistic Types

time_resolution.description: Optional specification of the time resolution for the variable, in case that is different from the dataset main time resolution.

variable_type.description: The type of operational data variable, selected from the standardised terms based on the ASPECT taxonomy.
variable_type.title: OperationalDataVariableType

items.title: Operational Data Variable

data_variables.title: Data Variables

description.description: Optional description of the dataset, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

end_date.description: End of the data period in the ISO 8601 standard format for a calendar date, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.
end_date.title: End Date

id.description: Unique ID of the reference operational wind farm dataset
id.title: Id

integrity_verification.description: Optional description of how the integrity of the data has been and/or can be verified. This field should not be empty if it is included. If any measures were undertaken to verify data integrity, they should always be described here. When this field is omitted, it shall be interpreted to mean that data integrity verification was not undertaken and/or not possible.
integrity_verification.title: Integrity Verification

label.description: Optional label of the reference wind farm dataset, which should not be empty if the field is included.
label.title: Label

start_date.description: Start of the data period in the ISO 8601 standard format for a calendar date, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.
start_date.title: Start Date

supplying_organisation.description: The organisation that supplied the data.

time_resolution.description: The main time resolution of the operational data, if relevant. For example, a SCADA dataset with all main variables at 10-minute resolution should have the time resolution specified as such, even when some variables (e.g. alarm status) do not have a meaningful time resolution. The time resolution can also be specified at the variable level, in case of deviations from the dataset main resolution.

items.title: Operational Dataset Metadata

operational_datasets.title: Operational Datasets

wind_farm_id.description: The ID of the wind farm in the 'wind_farms' section of the top-level of the EYA DEF document, containing the configuration data for the reference wind farm.
wind_farm_id.title: Wind Farm Id

reference_wind_farms.description: Optional list of metadata documents for the reference operational wind farms relevant to the EYA, if any. One metadata document shall be completed for each relevant reference operational wind farm.
reference_wind_farms.title: Reference Wind Farms

scenarios.description: List of energy yield assessment scenarios.

items.description: Single unique energy yield assessment scenario.

comments.description: Optional comments on the scenario, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the scenario, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

energy_assessment.description: Energy assessment details and results, including gross energy, plant performance, net energy and uncertainties.

gross_energy_assessment.description: Details and results for the assessment of gross energy yield.

comments.description: Optional comments on the gross energy assessment, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the gross energy assessment, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

gross_energy_assessment.title: Gross Energy Assessment

net_energy_assessment.description: Details and results for the assessment of net energy yield.

comments.description: Optional comments on the net energy assessment, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the net energy assessment, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

results.description: Net EYA predictions, including central estimates, overall uncertainties and results at different confidence levels.

net_energy_assessment.title: Net Energy Assessment

plant_performance_assessment.description: Plant performance loss assessment categories including results.

categories.description: Plant performance loss assessment categories including results.

comments.description: Optional comments on the plant performance loss category, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the plant performance loss category, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

label.description: Label of the plant performance loss category.
label.title: Plant Performance Category Label

subcategories.description: Plant performance loss assessment subcategories that fall under the category. The subcategory objects include details and results at the subcategory level.

basis.description: Basis of plant performance loss subcategory assessment. The basis describes the level of detail of the calculation or estimate used in the assessment of the subcategory.

comments.description: Optional comments on the plant performance loss subcategory, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the plant performance loss subcategory, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

items.description: Plant performance loss assessment subcategory element.

basis.description: Basis of plant performance loss subcategory element assessment. The basis describes the level of detail of the calculation or estimate used in the assessment of the element.

comments.description: Optional comments on the plant performance loss subcategory element, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the plant performance loss subcategory element, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

is_independent.description: Whether the plant performance loss subcategory element is independent of all other elements.
is_independent.title: Is Independent

label.description: Label of the plant performance loss subcategory element.
label.title: Label

results.description: Plant performance assessment subcategory element results.

variability.description: Considered variability in the plant performance loss subcategory element.

items.title: Plant Performance Subcategory Element

elements.description: Optional plant performance loss assessment elements that fall under the subcategory. The element objects include details and results at the element level. A breakdown of plant performance loss subcategories into elements is optional and can be included only for a subset of the subcategories, as relevant. Whereas the categories and subcategories are fixed, the user may freely define element labels.
elements.title: Elements

label.description: Label of the plant performance loss subcategory.
label.title: Plant Performance Subcategory Label

variability.description: Considered variability in the plant performance loss subcategory.

subcategories.title: Subcategories

categories.title: Categories

results.description: Overall plant performance loss assessment results.

plant_performance_assessment.title: Plant Performance Assessment

energy_assessment.title: Energy Assessment

id.description: Optional unique identifier of the scenario, which should not be empty if the field is included.
id.title: Id

is_main_scenario.description: Optional flag to specify whether or not it is the main scenario in the report.
is_main_scenario.title: Is Main Scenario

turbine_wind_resource_assessment.description: Wind resource assessment at the turbine locations.

comments.description: Optional comments on the turbine wind resource assessment, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the turbine wind resource assessment, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

results.description: Results of the wind resource assessment at the turbine location(s).

air_density.description: Final long-term air density estimates at the turbine location(s) at hub height in kilogram per cubic metre (kg m-3). The dimension of the first standard result dataset should be 'turbine_id'. Further results with other dimensions may also be included.
air_density.title: Air Density

ambient_turbulence_intensity.description: Final ambient turbulence intensity estimates at the turbine location(s) at hub height, as dimensionless values. The first standard result dataset should comprise the ambient turbulence intensity as a function of wind speed, with the dimensions 'turbine_id' and 'wind_speed' (in that order). The wind speed coordinates should be 1.0 metre per second bins centered on whole numbers, with the first bin half the width (i.e. 0.25, 1.0, 2.0, 3.0, ...). Further results with other dimensions may also be included.
ambient_turbulence_intensity.title: Ambient Turbulence Intensity

displacement_height.description: Estimated effective displacement of the boundary layer at the turbine location(s) due to vegetation (forestry) in metre. The displacement height is measured as positive upwards from the ground level. This field is optional as it is only relevant at forested sites. The dimension of the first standard result dataset should be 'turbine_id'. Further results with other dimensions, such as displacement height binned by wind direction, may also be included.
displacement_height.title: Displacement Height

probability.description: Final long-term probability distribution estimates at the turbine location(s) at hub height, as dimensionless values. The first standard result dataset should comprise the joint wind speed and direction probability distributions, with dimensions 'turbine_id', 'wind_speed' and 'wind_from_direction' (in that order). The wind speed coordinates should be 1.0 metre per second bins centered on whole numbers, with the first bin half the width (i.e. 0.25, 1.0, 2.0, 3.0, ...). The wind direction coordinates should be twelve 30.0 degree bins, with the the first bin centered at 0.0. Further results with other dimensions may also be included.
probability.title: Probability

temperature.description: Final long-term temperature estimates at the turbine location(s) at hub height in degree C. The dimension of the first standard result dataset should be 'turbine_id'. Further results with other dimensions may also be included.
temperature.title: Temperature

wind_shear_exponent.description: Final power law wind shear exponent estimates at the turbine location(s). The dimension of the first standard result dataset should be 'turbine_id'. Further results with other dimensions may also be included.
wind_shear_exponent.title: Wind Shear Exponent

wind_speed.description: Final long-term wind speed estimates at the turbine location(s) at hub height in metre per second (m s-1). The dimension of the first standard result dataset should be 'turbine_id'. Further results with other dimensions may be included optionally.
wind_speed.title: Wind Speed

results.title: Turbine Wind Resource Results

anyOf.description: Details of weighting applied to estimate turbine wind resource.

source_wind_data.description: Optional specification of the weight applied to the prediction based on each source of wind data when making the final wind resource estimate at each target turbine location. The dimensions of the first standard weighting specification dataset should be 'turbine_id' (the target turbine of the estimate for which the weight is applied), 'wind_dataset_id' (the source wind dataset whose prediction the weight is applied to), 'location_id' (where the wind dataset has more than one location, otherwise omitted), and 'variable_id' (if different weights were applied to different variables, such as wind speed and wind direction weighted differently, otherwise omitted). Further results with additional dimensions may optionally be included, in which case the initial set of dimensions must be the same as those for the first standard dataset. For example, if weights are applied by wind direction bin, an additional dataset with dimensions 'turbine_id', 'wind_dataset_id', 'location_id', 'variable_id' and 'wind_from_direction' (bin) may be included.
source_wind_data.title: Source Wind Data

anyOf.title: Turbine Wind Resource Weighting

weighting.description: Optional specification of the weighting applied to estimate the wind resource at the turbine location(s),relevant for example when predictions from different measurement stations were weighted individually at each turbine based on representativeness.

wind_resource_assessment_id_reference.description: The ID of the wind resource assessment on which the turbine wind resource assessment is based. This must refer to an ID of a wind resource assessment included at the top level of the EYA DEF. The schema requires that a turbine wind resource assessment is based on only one wind resource assessment.
wind_resource_assessment_id_reference.title: Wind Resource Assessment Id Reference

wind_uncertainty_assessment.description: Wind related uncertainty assessment categories including results.

categories.description: Wind related uncertainty assessment categories including results.

items.description: Category of a wind related uncertainty assessment.

comments.description: Optional comments on the wind related uncertainty category, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the wind related uncertainty category, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

label.description: Label of the wind related uncertainty assessment category.
label.title: Wind Uncertainty Category Label

results.description: Wind related uncertainty assessment category results.

subcategories.description: Wind related uncertainty assessment subcategories that fall under the category. The subcategory objects include details and results at the subcategory level.

items.description: Subcategory of a wind related uncertainty assessment.

comments.description: Optional comments on the wind related uncertainty subcategory, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the wind related uncertainty subcategory, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

items.description: Subcategory element of a wind related uncertainty assessment.

comments.description: Optional comments on the wind related uncertainty subcategory element, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the wind related uncertainty subcategory element, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

label.description: Label of the wind related uncertainty subcategory element.
label.title: Label

results.description: Wind related uncertainty assessment subcategory element results.

items.title: Wind Uncertainty Subcategory Element

elements.description: Wind related uncertainty assessment elements that fall under the subcategory. The element objects include details and results at the element level. A breakdown of wind related uncertainty subcategories into elements is optional and can be included only for a subset of the subcategories, as relevant. Whereas the categories and subcategories are fixed, the user may freely define element labels.
elements.title: Elements

label.description: Label of the wind related uncertainty subcategory.
label.title: Wind Uncertainty Subcategory Label

results.description: Wind related uncertainty assessment subcategory results.

items.title: Wind Uncertainty Subcategory

subcategories.title: Subcategories

items.title: Wind Uncertainty Category

categories.title: Categories

results.description: Overall wind related uncertainty assessment results.

wind_uncertainty_assessment.title: Wind Uncertainty Assessment

turbine_wind_resource_assessment.title: Turbine Wind Resource Assessment

wind_farm_ids.description: List of the IDs for all wind farms included in the scenario. Each ID refers to a wind farm configuration data object within the 'wind_farms' section of the top-level of the EYA DEF document. Only wind farms for which turbine interaction effects are modelled shall be included.
wind_farm_ids.title: Wind Farm Ids

items.title: Scenario

scenarios.title: Scenarios

title.description: Title of the energy yield assessment (EYA) report.
examples: Energy yield assessment of the Barefoot Wind Farm
title.title: Title

items.description: Wind turbine performance specifications according to the IEC-61400-16 data model.
items.title: Turbine Model Specifications

turbine_models.description: List of wind turbine model specifications.
turbine_models.title: Turbine Models

utc_offset.description: The offset in hours of the local time zone used for the EYA relative to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). It is applied to UTC time to convert it to local time, hence positive for time zones ahead of UTC and negative for time zones behind UTC (e.g. -6.0 for MST and 9.5 for ACST). All data where the time zone is relevant (e.g. hourly time series and diurnal profiles) must be consistent with this one UTC offset.
utc_offset.title: Utc Offset

uuid.description: Optional UUID of the EYA DEF document.
uuid.title: UUID

wind_farms.description: List of all wind farms considered in the EYA. This should comprise internal, external and future wind farms, including those used as reference wind farms in the wind resource assessment, if any. If different configurations are assessed for one or more internal and/or future wind farms in different scenarios, a wind farm object must be completed for each unique configuration, with the relevant configurations for each scenario referenced by wind farm ID.

items.description: A collection of wind turbines considered as one unit (plant).

abbreviation.description: Optional abbreviated label of the wind farm.
abbreviation.title: Abbreviation

comments.description: Optional comments on the wind farm, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the wind farm, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

export_capacity.description: Optional specification of the maximum permanently transmittable power (in MW) from the wind farm at the grid connection, or equivalent, if known. If not included it shall be assumed that the wind farm can transmit the full produced output.
export_capacity.title: Export Capacity

id.description: Unique identifier of the wind farm.
id.title: Id

installed_capacity.description: The maximum production (in MW) of the wind farm under typical conditions. If there are features in place to increase power output beyond the stated nameplate power of the turbines (e.g. so-called power boost solutions), the wind farm installed capacity should correspond to that increased power, insofar as it is reached under typical conditions and not only in rare exceptions.
installed_capacity.title: Installed Capacity

label.description: Label or name of the wind farm.
label.title: Label

operational_lifetime_end_date.description: The operational lifetime end date of the wind farm in the ISO 8601 standard format for a calendar date, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.
operational_lifetime_end_date.title: Operational Lifetime End Date

operational_lifetime_start_date.description: The operational lifetime start date of the wind farm in the ISO 8601 standard format for a calendar date, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.
operational_lifetime_start_date.title: Operational Lifetime Start Date

relevance.description: The relevance of the wind farm for the assessment ('internal', 'external' or 'future').
relevance.title: Wind Farm Relevance

restrictions.description: List of operational restrictions at the wind farm level.
restrictions.title: Restrictions

turbines.description: List of specifications for constituent turbines.

items.description: Specification of all details for a turbine configuration.

comments.description: Optional comments on the turbine, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

description.description: Optional description of the turbine, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

ground_level_altitude.description: The ground level altitude (base elevation) of the turbine (in m).
ground_level_altitude.title: Ground Level Altitude

hub_height.description: The hub height of the turbine above ground level (in m).
hub_height.title: Hub Height

label.description: Label of the turbine, if different from the 'id'.
label.title: Label

location.description: The horizontal spatial location of the turbine.
location.title: Location

operational_lifetime_end_date.description: Optional operational lifetime end date of the individual turbine in the ISO 8601 standard format for a calendar date, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.
operational_lifetime_end_date.title: Operational Lifetime End Date

operational_lifetime_start_date.description: Optional operational lifetime start date of the individual turbine in the ISO 8601 standard format for a calendar date, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.
operational_lifetime_start_date.title: Operational Lifetime Start Date

restrictions.description: List of operational restrictions at the turbine level.
restrictions.title: Restrictions

turbine_model_id.description: Unique identifier of the turbine model.
turbine_model_id.title: Turbine Model Id

items.title: Turbine Configuration

turbines.title: Turbines

items.title: Wind Farm Configuration

wind_farms.title: Wind Farms

wind_resource_assessments.description: List of wind resource assessments, including results, at the measurement station locations.

items.description: Wind resource assessment at the measurement location(s).

comments.description: Optional comments on the wind resource assessment, which should not be empty if the field is included.
comments.title: Comments

dataset_statistics.description: Statistics relating to the wind resource assessment datasets, such as data availability.

data_availability.description: Dimensionless raw data availability (also known as data recovery rate and data coverage) for the primary inputs to the wind resource assessment. The standard required dataset(s) should report data availability on a monthly basis, with dimensions 'wind_dataset_id', 'location_id' (where the wind dataset has more than one location, otherwise omitted), 'point_id', 'year' and 'month' (in that order) for datasets from wind measurement stations and meteorological reference sources; and dimensions 'reference_wind_farm_id', 'operational_dataset_id', 'variable_id' (where data availability is not identical across all relevant variables within the operational dataset, otherwise omitted), 'turbine_id' (for variables at the turbine level and where data availability is not identical across all turbines, otherwise omitted), 'year' and 'month' (in that order) for operational reference wind farm datasets. Additional datasets with other dimensions may be included optionally. The raw data availability is defined as the proportion of samples available in the raw dataset relative to the possible maximum amount of samples within a certain time frame (i.e. if no data were missing), before the author of the EYA has undertaken any data filtering. The raw dataset may include filtering inherent in the process of creating it, such as quality filtering implemented in the firmware of remote sensing devices (RSDs), and the raw data availability then describes the state of the dataset after such filtering has been applied.
data_availability.title: Data Availability

dataset_statistics.title: Wind Resource Dataset Statistics

description.description: Optional description of the wind resource assessment, which should not be empty if the field is included.
description.title: Description

id.description: Unique ID of the wind resource assessment within the EYA DEF document, used to reference it from other parts of the document.
id.title: Id

results.description: Final results of the wind resource assessment at the measurement location(s). Results should generally be included at the primary measurement height and extrapolated to all assessed turbine hub heights at each measurement location, as relevant.

air_density.description: Final long-term air density estimates at the measurement location(s) in kilogram per cubic metre (kg m-3). This field is optional since some wind measurement stations may lack measurements required to derive air density estimates, but it should always be included when relevant data are available. The dimensions of the first standard result dataset should be 'wind_dataset_id', 'location_id' (where the wind dataset has more than one location, otherwise omitted), and 'height' (in that order). Further results with other dimensions may also be included.
air_density.title: Air Density

ambient_turbulence_intensity.description: Final ambient turbulence intensity estimates at the measurement location(s), as dimensionless values. This field is optional since some measurement devices may lack meaningful turbulence measurements, but it should always be included when relevant turbulence data are available. The first standard result dataset should comprise the ambient turbulence intensity as a function of wind speed, with the dimensions 'wind_dataset_id', 'location_id' (where the wind dataset has more than one location, otherwise omitted), 'height' and 'wind_speed' (in that order). The wind speed coordinates should be 1.0 metre per second bins centered on whole numbers, with the first bin half the width (i.e. 0.25, 1.0, 2.0, 3.0, ...). Further results with other dimensions may also be included.
ambient_turbulence_intensity.title: Ambient Turbulence Intensity

displacement_height.description: Estimated effective displacement of the boundary layer at the measurement location(s) due to vegetation (forestry) in metre. The displacement height is measured as positive upwards from the ground level. This field is optional as it is only relevant at forested sites. The dimensions of the first standard result dataset should be 'wind_dataset_id' and 'location_id' (where the wind dataset has more than one location, otherwise omitted). Further results with other dimensions, such as displacement height binned by wind direction, may also be included.
displacement_height.title: Displacement Height

probability.description: Final long-term probability distribution estimates at the measurement location(s), as dimensionless values. The first standard result dataset should comprise the joint wind speed and direction probability distributions, with dimensions 'wind_dataset_id', 'location_id' (where the wind dataset has multiple locations, otherwise omitted), 'height', 'wind_speed' and 'wind_from_direction' (in that order). The wind speed coordinates should be 1.0 metre per second bins centered on whole numbers, with the first bin half the width (i.e. 0.25, 1.0, 2.0, 3.0, ...). The wind direction coordinates should be twelve 30.0 degree bins, with the the first bin centered at 0.0. Further results with other dimensions may be included optionally.
probability.title: Probability

temperature.description: Final long-term temperature estimates at the measurement location(s) in degree C. This field is optional since some wind measurement stations may lack measurements of temperature, but it should always be included when relevant temperature data are available. The dimensions of the first standard result dataset should be 'wind_dataset_id', 'location_id' (where the wind dataset has more than one location, otherwise omitted), and 'height' (in that order). Further results with other dimensions may also be included.
temperature.title: Temperature

wind_shear_exponent.description: Final long-term power law wind shear exponent estimates at the measurement location(s). This field is optional since some wind measurement stations may only include a single measurement height, but it should always be included when relevant wind shear exponent data are available. The dimension(s) of the first standard result dataset should be 'wind_dataset_id' and 'location_id' (where the wind dataset has more than one location, otherwise omitted). Further results with other dimensions may also be included.
wind_shear_exponent.title: Wind Shear Exponent

wind_speed.description: Final long-term wind speed estimate(s) at the measurement location(s) in metre per second (m s-1). The dimensions of the first standard result dataset should be 'wind_dataset_id', 'location_id' (where the wind dataset has more than one location, otherwise omitted), and 'height' (in that order). Further results with other dimensions may be included optionally.
wind_speed.title: Wind Speed

results.title: Wind Resource Results

items.title: Wind Resource Assessment

wind_resource_assessments.title: Wind Resource Assessments

title: IEC 61400-15-2 EYA DEF Schema
